description: Triangle T(n,k): write n in base 10, reverse order of digits.
comments: The length of n-th row is given in A055642(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 04 2012According to the formula for T(n,1), columns are numbered starting with 1. One might also number columns starting with the offset 0, as to have the coefficient of 10^k in column k. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 21 2013
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..2500 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,1) = A010879(n); T(n,A055642(n)) = A000030(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 04 2012
prog: (Haskell)a031298 n k = a031298_tabf !! n !! ka031298_row n = a031298_tabf !! na031298_tabf = iterate succ [0] where   succ []     = [1]   succ (9:ds) = 0 : succ ds   succ (d:ds) = (d + 1) : ds-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 04 2012(PARI) T(n,k)=n\10^(k-1)%10 \\ - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 21 2013
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: Initial 0 and better name by _Philippe Del√©ham_, Oct 20 2011.
